name: Squat
description: A fundamental lower body exercise that targets quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Lower your body by bending knees and hips
Keep your back straight and chest up
Lower until thighs are parallel to ground
Push through heels to return to starting position

formCheckpoints.description: Starting position with straight legs and upright torso
Bottom position - thighs parallel to ground
Return to starting position

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep knees tracking over toes throughout the movement
commonMistakes.description: This can cause knee injury and reduces exercise effectiveness

commonMistakes.visualCue: Maintain upright torso, chest up
commonMistakes.description: Excessive forward lean puts strain on lower back

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep entire foot flat, especially heels
commonMistakes.description: Lifting heels reduces stability and power

name: Front Squat
description: A barbell squat variation with the bar positioned in front, emphasizing quadriceps and core strength
instructions: Position bar across front deltoids with crossed arms or clean grip
Keep elbows high and chest up
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Lower by bending knees and hips while keeping torso upright
Descend until thighs are parallel to ground
Drive through heels to return to starting position

name: Back Squat
description: The classic barbell squat with bar positioned on upper back, allowing for maximum loading
instructions: Position bar on upper traps or rear deltoids
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out
Keep chest up and core braced
Lower by bending knees and hips simultaneously
Descend until thighs are parallel to ground or below
Drive through entire foot to return to standing position

name: Push-up
description: A classic upper body exercise targeting chest, shoulders, and triceps
instructions: Start in plank position with hands shoulder-width apart
Lower body until chest nearly touches ground
Keep body in straight line
Push back up to starting position

formCheckpoints.description: Starting plank position with straight body
Bottom position - chest nearly touching ground
Return to starting position

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep body in straight line from head to heels
commonMistakes.description: Sagging hips reduces core engagement and can cause back strain

commonMistakes.visualCue: Lower until chest nearly touches ground
commonMistakes.description: Not going low enough reduces muscle activation

name: Deadlift
description: A compound exercise targeting posterior chain muscles
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Bend at hips and knees to grip bar
Keep back straight and chest up
Lift by extending hips and knees
Lower bar with controlled motion

formCheckpoints.description: Starting position - feet hip-width, bar over mid-foot
Grip position - back straight, chest up
Full extension - hips and knees fully extended

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep back straight and chest up throughout
commonMistakes.description: Rounded back can cause serious injury

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep bar close to legs throughout the lift
commonMistakes.description: Bar should travel in a straight vertical line

name: Plank
description: An isometric core strengthening exercise
instructions: Start in push-up position
Lower to forearms
Keep body in straight line
Hold position while engaging core
Breathe normally

formCheckpoints.description: Maintain straight line from head to heels

commonMistakes.mistake: Hips too high or too low
commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep hips level with shoulders and heels
commonMistakes.description: Hips should form straight line with body

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep neck neutral, look at floor
commonMistakes.description: Dropping head can strain neck

name: Lunge
description: A unilateral lower body exercise
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Step forward with one leg
Lower body until both knees are at 90 degrees
Push back to starting position
Repeat with other leg

formCheckpoints.description: Starting position - standing tall
Bottom position - both knees at 90 degrees
Return to starting position

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep front knee aligned over ankle
commonMistakes.description: Knee past toes increases injury risk

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep torso upright throughout
commonMistakes.description: Maintain vertical torso position

name: Bench Press
description: A compound upper body exercise for chest, shoulders, and triceps
instructions: Lie on bench with feet flat on floor
Grip bar slightly wider than shoulder-width
Lower bar to chest with control
Press bar up until arms are fully extended
Keep core engaged throughout

formCheckpoints.description: Starting position - bar at full extension
Bottom position - bar touches chest
Press back to starting position

commonMistakes.visualCue: Control the descent, pause at chest
commonMistakes.description: Bouncing reduces muscle engagement and can cause injury

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep feet flat on floor for stability
commonMistakes.description: Feet provide stability and power

name: Pull-up
description: An upper body pulling exercise targeting back and biceps
instructions: Hang from bar with palms facing away
Pull body up until chin clears bar
Lower with control to full extension
Keep core engaged and avoid swinging

formCheckpoints.description: Starting position - full arm extension
Top position - chin over bar
Lower with control to starting position

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep body still, use only arm strength
commonMistakes.description: Swinging reduces muscle engagement

commonMistakes.mistake: Not going full range of motion
commonMistakes.visualCue: Lower until arms are fully extended
commonMistakes.description: Incomplete ROM reduces effectiveness

name: Overhead Press
description: A vertical pressing movement for shoulders and triceps
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hold bar at shoulder height
Press bar overhead until arms are extended
Lower with control to starting position
Keep core tight throughout

formCheckpoints.description: Starting position - bar at shoulder height
Top position - arms fully extended overhead
Lower with control to starting position

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep core tight, minimal back arch
commonMistakes.description: Excessive arching can cause lower back strain

commonMistakes.visualCue: Press bar straight up, not forward
commonMistakes.description: Bar should travel in vertical line

name: Romanian Deadlift
description: A hip-hinge movement targeting hamstrings and glutes
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hinge at hips while keeping knees slightly bent
Lower weight along legs
Feel stretch in hamstrings
Return to standing by extending hips

formCheckpoints.description: Starting position - standing tall
Bottom position - feel stretch in hamstrings
Return by extending hips

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep knees slightly bent, focus on hip hinge
commonMistakes.description: RDL is a hip-dominant movement

commonMistakes.visualCue: Maintain neutral spine throughout
commonMistakes.description: Keep back straight to protect spine

name: Dumbbell Row
description: A unilateral pulling exercise for back muscles
instructions: Bend over with one knee on bench
Pull dumbbell to lower chest/upper abdomen
Squeeze back muscles at top
Lower with control
Repeat on other side

formCheckpoints.description: Bent over position with one knee on bench
Pull dumbbell to lower chest
Lower with control

commonMistakes.visualCue: Control the movement, no swinging
commonMistakes.description: Use back muscles, not momentum

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep torso stable throughout
commonMistakes.description: Maintain neutral spine position

name: Burpee
description: A full-body explosive movement combining squat, plank, and jump
instructions: Start standing
Squat down and place hands on floor
Jump feet back to plank position
Do a push-up (optional)
Jump feet forward and explode up

formCheckpoints.description: Starting standing position
Squat down and place hands on floor
Jump back to plank position
Jump up explosively

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep body straight in plank
commonMistakes.description: Maintain proper plank form

commonMistakes.visualCue: Land on balls of feet, absorb impact
commonMistakes.description: Soft landing reduces injury risk

name: Mountain Climber
description: A dynamic core and cardio exercise
instructions: Start in plank position
Alternate bringing knees to chest
Keep hips level and core engaged
Maintain steady breathing
Move at controlled pace

name: Jumping Jacks
description: A classic full-body cardio exercise
instructions: Stand with feet together and arms at sides
Jump while spreading legs and raising arms
Land softly with feet apart
Jump back to starting position
Maintain rhythm and breathing

name: Bicep Curl
description: An isolation exercise for biceps
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hold weights with arms extended
Curl weights to shoulders
Squeeze biceps at top
Lower with control

name: Tricep Dip
description: A bodyweight exercise targeting triceps
instructions: Sit on edge of bench or chair
Place hands on edge, fingers forward
Slide forward off bench
Lower body by bending elbows
Push back up to starting position

name: Leg Press
description: A machine-based lower body exercise
instructions: Sit in leg press machine
Place feet shoulder-width on platform
Lower weight by bending knees
Press through heels to extend legs
Keep back flat against pad

name: Calf Raise
description: An isolation exercise for calf muscles
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Rise up onto balls of feet
Hold at top for a moment
Lower with control
Repeat for desired reps

name: Russian Twist
description: A rotational core exercise
instructions: Sit on floor with knees bent
Lean back slightly, keeping back straight
Rotate torso side to side
Keep core engaged throughout
Add weight for increased difficulty

name: Hip Thrust
description: A glute-focused exercise
instructions: Sit with upper back against bench
Place feet flat on floor
Drive hips up by squeezing glutes
Hold at top for a moment
Lower with control

formCheckpoints.description: Starting position - upper back on bench
Top position - hips fully extended
Lower with control

commonMistakes.visualCue: Focus on hip extension, not back arch
commonMistakes.description: Squeeze glutes, don't arch back excessively

commonMistakes.visualCue: Keep knees aligned with feet
commonMistakes.description: Maintain proper knee alignment

name: Side Plank
description: An isometric exercise targeting obliques
instructions: Lie on side with elbow under shoulder
Lift hips to form straight line
Hold position while engaging core
Keep body aligned
Switch sides

name: Box Jump
description: An explosive plyometric exercise
instructions: Stand facing box or platform
Swing arms and jump onto box
Land softly with both feet
Stand fully on box
Step down and repeat

name: Wall Sit
description: An isometric lower body exercise targeting quadriceps and glutes
instructions: Stand with back against wall
Slide down until knees are at 90 degrees
Keep feet flat on floor, shoulder-width apart
Hold position while engaging quadriceps and glutes
Keep back flat against wall
Breathe normally

name: Hollow Hold
description: An isometric core exercise that strengthens the entire anterior chain
instructions: Lie on back with arms extended overhead
Lift shoulders and legs off ground
Keep lower back pressed to floor
Hold position while engaging core
Maintain straight body line
Breathe steadily

name: Dead Bug Hold
description: An isometric core stability exercise performed in supine position
instructions: Lie on back with arms extended toward ceiling
Lift knees to 90 degrees
Press lower back into floor
Hold position while maintaining core engagement
Keep breathing steady
Hold for desired duration

name: Reverse Plank
description: An isometric exercise targeting posterior chain and core
instructions: Sit on floor with legs extended
Place hands behind you, fingers pointing forward
Lift hips to form straight line from head to heels
Keep body aligned and core engaged
Hold position while breathing normally
Avoid letting hips sag

name: Superman Hold
description: An isometric exercise targeting posterior chain and lower back
instructions: Lie face down on floor
Extend arms forward and legs straight
Lift arms, chest, and legs off ground simultaneously
Hold position while engaging glutes and lower back
Keep neck neutral
Breathe normally

name: Glute Bridge Hold
description: An isometric glute and core strengthening exercise
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent, feet flat on floor
Lift hips up by squeezing glutes
Form straight line from knees to shoulders
Hold position while engaging glutes and core
Keep feet flat and core tight
Breathe normally

name: Single Leg Glute Bridge Hold
description: An advanced isometric glute exercise with unilateral loading
instructions: Lie on back with one knee bent, foot flat
Extend other leg straight
Lift hips by squeezing glutes
Hold position while keeping hips level
Engage core to prevent rotation
Switch legs and repeat

name: L-Sit Hold
description: An advanced isometric core and upper body exercise
instructions: Sit on floor or parallel bars
Place hands beside or behind hips
Press down and lift body off ground
Extend legs straight to form L shape
Hold position while engaging core
Keep shoulders down and chest up

name: Wall Handstand Hold
description: An advanced isometric upper body and core exercise
instructions: Start in downward dog facing wall
Walk feet up wall while walking hands closer
Form straight line from hands to feet
Hold position while engaging shoulders and core
Keep body aligned and breathe normally
Come down slowly when finished

name: Farmer's Walk
description: An isometric grip and full-body strength exercise
instructions: Pick up heavy weights in each hand
Stand tall with shoulders back
Walk forward with controlled steps
Maintain strong grip throughout
Keep core engaged and back straight
Walk for desired distance or time

name: Forearm Plank
description: A variation of plank performed on forearms for increased stability
instructions: Start in plank position on forearms
Keep elbows directly under shoulders
Form straight line from head to heels
Engage core and glutes
Hold position while breathing normally
Avoid letting hips sag or rise

name: High Plank Hold
description: An isometric core exercise performed in push-up position
instructions: Start in push-up position
Place hands directly under shoulders
Form straight line from head to heels
Engage core, glutes, and shoulders
Hold position while breathing steadily
Keep body aligned throughout

name: Jump Squat
description: An explosive plyometric exercise combining squat and vertical jump
instructions: Start in squat position with feet shoulder-width apart
Lower into squat by bending knees and hips
Explosively jump up as high as possible
Swing arms upward for momentum
Land softly on balls of feet
Immediately descend into next squat

name: Broad Jump
description: A horizontal plyometric jump targeting lower body power
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Swing arms back and bend knees
Explosively jump forward as far as possible
Land softly with both feet
Absorb impact by bending knees
Stand up and reset for next jump

name: Tuck Jump
description: An explosive vertical jump with knees pulled to chest
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Bend knees slightly and swing arms back
Explosively jump up as high as possible
Pull knees toward chest in mid-air
Land softly on balls of feet
Immediately prepare for next jump

name: Single Leg Hop
description: A unilateral plyometric exercise for single-leg power and stability
instructions: Stand on one leg with slight knee bend
Swing arms back for momentum
Hop forward or in place on single leg
Land softly on ball of foot
Absorb impact and immediately hop again
Switch legs and repeat

name: Lateral Bound
description: A side-to-side plyometric exercise targeting lateral power
instructions: Stand on one leg with slight bend
Push off explosively to side
Land on opposite leg
Immediately bound back to other side
Keep core engaged throughout
Maintain controlled rhythm

name: Depth Jump
description: An advanced plyometric exercise involving drop and rebound jump
instructions: Stand on box or platform
Step off and land on ground
Immediately upon landing, explode upward
Jump as high as possible
Land softly and reset
Focus on quick ground contact time

name: Plyometric Push-up
description: An explosive upper body plyometric exercise
instructions: Start in push-up position
Lower body with control
Explosively push up so hands leave ground
Land softly and immediately lower again
Keep body in straight line
Maintain controlled rhythm

name: Skater Jump
description: A lateral plyometric exercise mimicking speed skating movement
instructions: Stand on one leg with slight bend
Jump laterally to opposite side
Land on opposite leg with trailing leg behind
Immediately jump back to other side
Swing arms for momentum and balance
Maintain low center of gravity

name: Split Jump
description: An explosive plyometric exercise performed in lunge position
instructions: Start in lunge position
Explosively jump up and switch legs mid-air
Land in opposite lunge position
Immediately jump again and switch
Keep torso upright throughout
Land softly with controlled descent

name: Clapping Push-up
description: An advanced plyometric push-up variation with clap in mid-air
instructions: Start in push-up position
Lower body with control
Explosively push up with maximum force
Clap hands together in mid-air
Land softly on hands
Immediately prepare for next repetition

name: Single Leg Box Jump
description: An advanced unilateral plyometric exercise
instructions: Stand on one leg facing box
Bend knee and swing arms back
Explosively jump onto box with single leg
Land softly on box
Step down and reset
Switch legs and repeat

name: Ankle Hops
description: A low-impact plyometric exercise focusing on calf power
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Keep legs relatively straight
Hop up using only ankles and calves
Minimal knee bend
Land on balls of feet
Maintain quick, rhythmic hops

name: Star Jump
description: A full-body explosive plyometric exercise
instructions: Start in squat position
Explosively jump up
Spread legs and arms wide in mid-air
Form star shape with body
Land softly with feet together
Immediately return to squat position

name: Pike Jump
description: An explosive plyometric exercise with pike position in mid-air
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Bend knees and swing arms back
Explosively jump up
Bring knees toward chest while reaching for toes
Form pike position in mid-air
Land softly and reset

name: Hang Clean
description: An explosive Olympic lift variation starting from hang position
instructions: Start with bar at mid-thigh, feet hip-width apart
Keep back straight and chest up
Explosively extend hips and knees
Shrug shoulders and pull bar up
Drop under bar and catch in front rack position
Stand up with bar on shoulders
Lower bar with control

name: Power Clean
description: An explosive full-body Olympic lift from floor to shoulders
instructions: Start with bar on floor, feet hip-width apart
Bend at hips and knees to grip bar
Keep back straight and chest up
Drive through legs and extend hips explosively
Shrug and pull bar up with arms
Drop under bar and catch in front rack position
Stand up with bar on shoulders

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: A vertical pressing movement for shoulders using dumbbells
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hold dumbbells at shoulder height
Press dumbbells overhead until arms are extended
Keep core engaged and back straight
Lower with control to starting position
Maintain neutral wrist position

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
description: A chest exercise using dumbbells for greater range of motion
instructions: Lie on bench with feet flat on floor
Hold dumbbells at chest level
Press dumbbells up until arms are extended
Lower with control to starting position
Keep core engaged throughout
Maintain control of weights

name: Dumbbell Squat
description: A lower body exercise using dumbbells for added resistance
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold dumbbells at sides or at shoulders
Lower by bending knees and hips
Keep back straight and chest up
Descend until thighs are parallel to ground
Drive through heels to return to standing

name: Dumbbell Lunge
description: A unilateral lower body exercise with dumbbells
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hold dumbbells at sides
Step forward with one leg
Lower until both knees are at 90 degrees
Push back to starting position
Repeat with other leg

name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift
description: A hip-hinge movement using dumbbells to target posterior chain
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hold dumbbells in front of thighs
Hinge at hips while keeping knees slightly bent
Lower dumbbells along legs
Feel stretch in hamstrings
Return to standing by extending hips

name: Dumbbell Fly
description: An isolation exercise for chest muscles using dumbbells
instructions: Lie on bench with feet flat on floor
Hold dumbbells above chest with slight elbow bend
Lower dumbbells in wide arc until chest stretch
Keep slight bend in elbows throughout
Bring dumbbells back together above chest
Squeeze chest at top

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
description: An isolation exercise targeting lateral deltoids
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hold dumbbells at sides with palms facing in
Raise dumbbells out to sides until shoulder height
Keep slight bend in elbows
Lower with control to starting position
Avoid swinging or using momentum

name: Dumbbell Front Raise
description: An isolation exercise targeting anterior deltoids
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hold dumbbells in front of thighs
Raise dumbbells forward until shoulder height
Keep slight bend in elbows
Lower with control to starting position
Maintain core engagement

name: Dumbbell Tricep Extension
description: An isolation exercise targeting triceps
instructions: Stand or sit with feet flat
Hold dumbbell overhead with both hands
Lower dumbbell behind head by bending elbows
Keep elbows close to head
Extend arms to return to starting position
Squeeze triceps at top

name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
description: A bicep exercise with neutral grip targeting brachialis
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hold dumbbells with neutral grip (palms facing in)
Curl dumbbells to shoulders
Keep elbows at sides throughout
Lower with control to starting position
Maintain controlled movement

name: Dumbbell Goblet Squat
description: A front-loaded squat variation using single dumbbell
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold dumbbell vertically at chest level
Lower by bending knees and hips
Keep torso upright and chest up
Descend until thighs are parallel to ground
Drive through heels to return to standing

name: Dumbbell Step-up
description: A unilateral lower body exercise using dumbbells and platform
instructions: Stand facing box or platform
Hold dumbbells at sides
Step up with one foot onto platform
Drive through heel to stand fully on platform
Step down with control
Repeat with other leg

name: Dumbbell Pullover
description: An exercise targeting chest, lats, and serratus anterior
instructions: Lie on bench with only upper back supported
Hold dumbbell with both hands above chest
Lower dumbbell behind head in arc
Feel stretch in chest and lats
Pull dumbbell back to starting position
Keep slight bend in elbows

name: Dumbbell Shrug
description: An isolation exercise targeting trapezius muscles
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hold dumbbells at sides with palms facing in
Lift shoulders straight up toward ears
Hold at top for a moment
Lower with control to starting position
Avoid rolling shoulders

name: Dumbbell Reverse Fly
description: An isolation exercise targeting rear deltoids and rhomboids
instructions: Bend over with slight knee bend
Hold dumbbells with palms facing each other
Raise dumbbells out to sides
Squeeze rear delts and rhomboids
Lower with control to starting position
Keep slight bend in elbows

name: Dumbbell Calf Raise
description: An isolation exercise for calf muscles using dumbbells
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hold dumbbells at sides
Rise up onto balls of feet
Hold at top for a moment
Lower with control to starting position
Repeat for desired reps

name: Dumbbell Overhead Tricep Extension
description: A single-arm tricep isolation exercise
instructions: Stand or sit with feet flat
Hold dumbbell in one hand overhead
Lower dumbbell behind head by bending elbow
Keep elbow close to head and pointing forward
Extend arm to return to starting position
Switch arms and repeat

name: Dumbbell Arnold Press
description: A shoulder exercise combining rotation with overhead press
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Start with dumbbells at chest, palms facing you
Rotate and press dumbbells overhead
End with palms facing forward at top
Reverse motion to return to start
Keep core engaged throughout
